The death of a British soldier announced today took the tally for this month to thirteen, the highest since the invasion. OBL remains at large, 90% of the world's heroin is grown there, and the Saudi-sponsored Taliban are resurgent. What a waste.

Classic lack of planning for the administrative role.
 It isn't that significant from a military standpoint, but the lack of progress for the civilian population is what is driving this slugfest.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  UK Afghanistan death toll rises.
